sub_title: NLBIF node manager & Programme Manager International Biodiversity Infrastructures at Naturalis Biodiversity Center Nederland
summary: Scientist with broad expertise on ecology, biodiversity, conservation, GIS, R-programming, global climate change and land-use change impacts, niche modelling and more recently involved in the development of biodiversity research infrastructures like GBIF, DiSSCo, and LifeWatch and data standards development under TDWG.

treasury_media.title: Niels Raes | PhD | Naturalis Biodiversity Center, Leiden | NCB | Biodiversity Dynamics | ResearchGate
treasury_media.description: Niels Raes of Naturalis Biodiversity Center, Leiden NCB with expertise in Biogeography, Geoinformatics (GIS), Remote Sensing. Read 90 publications, 1 question, 7 answers, and contact Niels Raes on ResearchGate, the professional network for scientists.

projects.title: PRIDE - Drivers of the Pontocaspian RIse and Demise
projects.description:
The PRIDE programme investigates the evolution and demise of lakes systems and biota in the Black Sea, Caspian Sea and surroundings.

The programme combines climate-, geo- and bio- sciences and is conducted by 15 Early Stage Researchers. The PRIDE network contains 21 partipating institutes. More information about the background of the programme, its workpackages (WP1, WP2, WP3, WP4) and the 15 projects outlines can be found at http://pontocaspian.eu/.

PRIDE has received funding from the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement No 642973.

contributors.headline: NLBIF node manager & Programme Manager International Biodiversity Infrastructures at Naturalis Biodiversity Center Nederland

projects.title: NetBiomeCSA EUFP7 project
projects.description: NetBiome-CSA will extend and strengthen research partnerships and cooperation for smart and sustainable management of tropical and subtropical biodiversity in outermost regions (ORs) and overseas countries and territories (OCTs). This will be achieved through a participative process mobilising stakeholders, their knowledge and resources for initiatives such as policy and priority analysis, multi-stakeholder dialogues, exchange of good practices, training and issuing of recommendations. The project builds on the existing biodiversity research partnership created through the ERA-Net project NetBiome and takes on the challenge of mobilizing further stakeholders at all levels of the quadruple helix (knowledge institutions, enterprises, government and civil society) to address perceived priority challenges in conciliating conservation and sustainable management of tropical biodiversity with the sustainable development of Europe’s regions and territories, based on the benefits from high biodiversity. The project’s activities, specifically tailored to the needs and priorities identified by the ORs and OCTs, will contribute to: improved research and innovation governance; alignment of research efforts with policy needs strengthening evidence-based policies; enhanced implementation and impact of the EU Biodiversity Strategy and CBD Strategic Plan; innovative biodiversity management tools (Biodiversity Management Toolbox), increased regional socio-economic and cultural development; enhanced international visibility of ORs and OCTs and the uptake of their good practices, expertise and knowledge; effective international and trans-regional cooperation among European ORs and OCTs and with third countries.

profile_positions.description: Manager of the Netherlands Biodiversity Information Facility (NLBIF), the Dutch node of the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF), with the task to mobilize free and open biodiversity data for everyone and everywhere, facilitate the development of IT infrastructures that enable free and open sharing of biodiversity data, and engage a wide range of stakeholders with an interest in biodiversity data. Check https://www.gbif.org or https://www.nlbif.nl for more information.
profile_positions.title: NLBIF node manager

profile_positions.description: Member of the Dynamic Biodiversity group at Naturalis Biodiversity Center https://science.naturalis.nl/en/research/dynamic-biodiversity/about-dynamic-biodiversity/
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: Since 2015 I have carried out several consultancies regarding a) the local predicted impacts of climate change within regions, and b) the identification of suitable areas for the future conservation of target species.
profile_positions.title: Consultancies: Biodiversity and Climate Change

profile_positions.description: Analyse climate change impacts on WWF-NL priority conservation areas including Amazon, Cerrado, Congo basin, Miombo savanna, Borneo, Yangtze river basin, Arctic, Coral triangle and Southern Ocean.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow - Climate Change Impacts on WWF-NL priority conservation areas

profile_positions.description: Using botanical collections for Climate Smart Agriculture applications.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow - Climate Smart Agriculture

profile_positions.description: 'Back to the Future; biodiversity gradients revisited', dealing with biodiversity patterns of the Sunda shelf (Borneo, Sumatra, Java and Malaysia) in the past, present and future.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow - Biodiversity Sundaland

profile_positions.description: Research and consultancy in conservation areas of the north-western part of the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Project leader Ecology

profile_positions.description: Developing high spatial resolution botanical diversity maps of Borneo based on digitized herbarium records.
profile_positions.title: PhD - Biodiversity of Borneo

profile_positions.description: Analyzed the differences in the climber species composition and population structure between natural and logging canopy gaps to make recommendations for FSC certification and the silvicultural system.
profile_positions.title: Ecologist (Free-lance)

profile_positions.description: Participated in the development of a logging damage assessment system using liana functional groups; EU funded extension of the Tropenbos Guyana Programme. Coordinated fieldwork of the last liana enumeration (2001) in Guyana, compiled and analysed data of 10 years of fieldwork, developed the ‘Climbers of Guyana’ website,  and supervised two MSc. students with fieldwork and thesis writing.
profile_positions.title: Ecologist

profile_positions.description: Teaching in all MS Office applications and website design. Developed course manuals for the courses ‘website design’ and ‘MS Access’.
profile_positions.title: Computer teacher

profile_positions.description: Assisted Dr. B. Bordenave with fieldwork and the identification of the vouchers collected in the Asarco Mining Concession, Kaw Mountains, French Guiana. Developed 3-D map showing the different vegetation types occurring in the concession using GIS. Vegetation analyses were made in order to make recommendations for protected areas.
profile_positions.title: Free-lance botanist
